item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, September 12, 2024 at 6:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. OpenAI O1 Model (487 points | 287 comments)
2. Show HN: iFixit created a new USB-C, repairable soldering system (394 points | 172 comments)
3. Metformin decelerates aging clock in male monkeys (53 points | 15 comments)
4. Defusedxml – defusing XML bombs and other exploits (15 points | 2 comments)
5. GAZEploit: Remote keystroke inference attack by gaze estimation in VR/MR devices (115 points | 67 comments)
6. Kolmogorov-Arnold networks may make neural networks more understandable (176 points | 52 comments)
7. Show HN: Galaxy Visualization (14 points | 3 comments)
8. If I could dissect a sauropod (69 points | 9 comments)
9. Artie (YC S23) Is Hiring a Founding Designer ( | hide)
10. Ergo: Erlang-inspired event driven actor framework in Go (103 points | 51 comments)
11. Why Haskell? (241 points | 321 comments)
12. Jax and Equinox: What are they and why should I bother? (14 points | 1 comment)
13. Show HN: Goroutine Monitor Powered by eBPF (38 points | 1 comment)
14. Show HN: Repogather – copy relevant files to clipboard for LLM coding workflows (34 points | 20 comments)
15. Peer Gynt quilt, Part 1 (2021) (47 points | 3 comments)
16. Linear, symmetric, self-selecting 14-bit molecular memristors (2023) (87 points | 48 comments)
17. DEF Con 32 – AMD Sinkclose Universal Ring-2 Privilege Escalation (Not Redacted) [pdf] (156 points | 15 comments)
18. Qubit Transistors Reach Error Correction Benchmark (45 points | 9 comments)
19. The final release of PalmOS, 6.1 Cobalt: colour, multimedia, and multitasking (4 points | discuss)
20. 1913: When Hitler, Trotsky, Tito, Freud and Stalin all lived in the same place (55 points | 25 comments)
21. Show HN: Konty – A Balsamiq-alternative lo-fi wireframe tool for modern apps (320 points | 117 comments)
22. Large-Scale Generation of Transit Maps from OpenStreetMap Data (217 points | 24 comments)
23. Exponential Rate Limiting (62 points | 13 comments)
24. A MiniGolf game for Palm OS (305 points | 92 comments)
25. Why Oxide Chose Illumos (174 points | 104 comments)
26. Remix's concurrent submissions are fundamentally flawed (26 points | 1 comment)
27. Old Easter Island genomes show no sign of a population collapse (78 points | 39 comments)
28. We spent $20 to achieve RCE and accidentally became the admins of .mobi (1486 points | 334 comments)
29. Critical Resources and the First 14 KB (2022) (45 points | 5 comments)
30. Reader-LM: Small Language Models for Cleaning and Converting HTML to Markdown (173 points | 39 comments)
